intro: Bunium pilosum, commonly known as goat's beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and feathery, fern-like leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Bunium pilosum is native to Central Asia and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
